body_html:
@yinghai

  1. the group filter in ideep is incomplete.
    This causes the compute API is not reentant for same weight with group.
    This issue has been fixed in latest ideep.

  2. The assignment operator of tensor is a shadow copy.
    tensor A = B ----> A and B share same data buffer.
    Then, the reorder operator does not support inplace case.
    To fix this, the A tensor must be init with new buffer, as in this patch.
body_text:
@yinghai


the group filter in ideep is incomplete.
This causes the compute API is not reentant for same weight with group.
This issue has been fixed in latest ideep.


The assignment operator of tensor is a shadow copy.
tensor A = B   ----> A and B share same data buffer.
Then, the reorder operator does not support inplace case.
To fix this, the A tensor must be init with new buffer, as in this patch.
body:
@yinghai 
1. the group filter in ideep is incomplete.
This causes the compute API is not reentant for same weight with group.
This issue has been fixed in latest ideep.

2. The assignment operator of tensor is a shadow copy.
tensor A = B   ----> A and B share same data buffer.
Then, the reorder operator does not support inplace case.
To fix this, the A tensor must be init with new buffer, as in this patch.
